Ingredients.3: 1 (3 pound) butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cubed

Ingredients.4: 4 cups vegetable broth, or more to taste

Ingredients.9: 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg, or to taste

Ingredients.10: 0.25 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.11: 0.25 teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste

Ingredients.12: 0.25 teaspoon ground ginger, or to taste

Ingredients.15: 1 tablespoon plain yogurt, or to taste

Directions.1: Heat olive oil in a pressure cooker over medium-high heat. Saute onion until translucent but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add squash, broth, sweet potatoes, apples, garlic, cinnamon, nutmeg, black pepper, cumin, ginger, and salt.

Directions.2: Close and lock the lid. Bring to high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low; cook until squash and sweet potatoes are fork-tender, about 15 minutes.

Directions.3: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions. Unlock and remove lid. Liquefy soup using an immersion blender. Stir in half-and-half. Serve with a dollop of yogurt on top.
